metadata.title: CVE-2020-28368 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Xen through 4.14.x allows guest OS administrators to obtain sensitiveinformation (such as AES keys from outside the guest) via a side-channelattack on a power/energy monitoring interface, aka a "Platypus" attack.NOTE: there is only one logically independent fix: to change the accesscontrol for each such interface in Xen.

criterions.comment: xen: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
